meanings.definition: A person who designs or makes costumes.
meanings.sent1: The costumers at the theater created beautiful outfits for the actors.
meanings.sent2: During Halloween, many costumers enjoy sewing their own costumes.
meanings.sent3: The costumers decided to have a costume-making competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: She was a true artist, turning fabric into magic like a costumer.
meanings.sent5: The costumers' creations brought the characters to life on stage.

meanings.sent1: The costumers at the party were dressed as superheroes and princesses.
meanings.sent2: Children love to be costumers on Halloween and pretend to be their favorite characters.
meanings.sent3: The costumers giggled as they tried on silly outfits for the costume party.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the actor transformed into a costumer of historical figures.
meanings.sent5: The costumers paraded around the convention in elaborate outfits.

meanings.definition: The act of providing or wearing costumes.
meanings.sent1: The costumers for the school play had to gather materials and sew the costumes.
meanings.sent2: At the carnival, there were many costumers showcasing their creative outfits.
meanings.sent3: The costumers rushed to get dressed before the costume contest started.
meanings.sent4: The costumers transformed the ordinary street into a magical costume parade.
meanings.sent5: The costumers' dedication to their craft made the event truly special.
